div.pre: 2131 Centuripe, 1952 Burial: c. 340 B.C. (Jenkins) Contents: 88 AR. Found during road work Rhegium: 2 tetradr. Acragas: 1 tetradr. Camarina: 1 tetradr. Leontini: 2 tetradr. Messana: 2 tetradr. Syracuse: 1 decadr. (Euainetos type, griffin hd. symbol) 4 tetradr. Athens: 2 tetradr. (5th cent.) Pegasi Corinth: 41 (incl. 2 Per. V signed Ε) Ambracia: 7 (see below) Anactorium: (BMC pl. 31, 16) Leucas: 18 (incl. 7 with caduceus) Syracuse: 6 Disposition: Syracuse † Gentili, NSc 1954, pp. 70-7, illus. Jenkins, ANSCent., pp. 372-3 Currò Pisanò, AIIN 1962-4, pp. 229-30 Totals for mints given above are those of Gentili, but Ravel, Ambracia was not available to him. In 1969 K noted the following 10 varieties: 1 early issue, Ravel 98, 105, 127, 137, 146, 161, 166, 187 (2). The totals for Corinth or Leucas should probably be reduced accordingly
